abstract: Asynchronously opens a URL, following system conventions.

declaration.code: @MainActor @preconcurrency func callAsFunction(_ url: URL, completion: @escaping (Bool) -> Void)

overview:
## Discussion

Don’t call this method directly. SwiftUI calls it when you call the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/OpenURLAction] structure that you get from the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Environment], using a URL and a completion handler as arguments:

For information about how Swift uses the `callAsFunction()` method to simplify call site syntax, see [https://docs.swift.org/swift-book/ReferenceManual/Declarations.html#ID622] in *The Swift Programming Language*.

items.description: Opens a URL, following system conventions.
items.name: callAsFunction(_:)

title: callAsFunction(_:completion:)
